column1: 1345|quarter to two|That period which is always so dangerous
column4: proved fatal to two more of the enemy. The last man had just gone to the wickets
column5: with the score at a hundred and thirty-one
column6: when a quarter to two arrived
column7: and with it the luncheon interval.

column1: 1345|one forty-five|The blow fell at precisely one forty-five (summer-time). Benson
column3: was offering me the fried potatoes at the moment
column4: and such was my emotion that I lofted six of them on the sideboard with the spoon.
